answerText: The Lesson[10] The Lesson is an example of a work from this movement, a name coined by Hungarian-born critic Martin Esslin.
heading: Terrapin |2013 | Editors 1 - FINAL | 2 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: At the end of this play, one character is presented with an armband and told that he has nothing to fear for what he has done. For 10 points each: [10] Name this Ionesco play, in which the Professor gives a rambling lecture to the inattentive Pupil, before drawing a knife from his desk and stabbing her to death.
